website_summaries.verdict: We wouldn't recommend it for high-output households or large offices, but the HP Photosmart D110a provides inexpensive access to HP's clever new ePrint and Web-connected apps.
pros: The HP Photosmart e-All-in-One D110a's interactive touch screen adds Web connectivity to the standard print, copy, and scan functions, at a lower price than other HP ePrint-connected devices
cons: Print speeds are languid and the smaller paper input capacity makes it a hassle to refill for bigger households
You also must have a wireless connection to use the D110 to its fullest potential

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one for me.
customer_reviews.text: I specifically ordered this printer as I had one for years and had very little issue. The only problem is that they don’t last forever. Ordered a replacement of the same make/model because I was familiar with it, & it lasted many years so I knew what to expect from it.
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Dopey rides again
customer_reviews.text: SHAME ON ME. This came from Amazon thru Cool Stuff. Purchased on June 6,2016 And lasted 4 months. When I checked sn. no.the one on the box was different from the printer. Will not print in black after 4 mos. of use. HP says my waranty expired in 2013. you see my purchase date. My fault for not paying attention. PIECE OF JUNK.
customer_reviews.author: raymond kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Good first impression, but doesn't take long to hit bottom
customer_reviews.text: This printer started out great. I had it installed wirelessly within minutes, and the print quality seemed just fine, even if it does use quite a bit of ink. A month later, I got spotty connection on the wireless, and getting paper jam errors, when there was no jam. I installed an XL HP cartridge, and it started clacking like it's stuck. It's SO loud the kids cover their ears! Two weeks later, I can't get a wireless connection at all, and I've changed NOTHING on my network. This product is a huge letdown, and needs to be tossed. I'm just upset that it's too late to get a refund from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: christy

customer_reviews.title: Very Dependable and Hardy.... mine has lasted for years
customer_reviews.text: I don't dislike anything about it. It is simple, faithful, and not expensive to replace ink cartridges. I don't know about Tech Support as I haven't had any problems and the Touch Screen works fine.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan1950

customer_reviews.title: HP PhotoSmart Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best small printers I have ever owned. I have had many printers and this one has the quality and speed of the larger corporate printers. My job in corporate was ordering or maintaining printers. I love this one and I believe you will too. Update almost four years later, I am still enjoying my printer with minimal problems: An occasional paper jam that clears instantly and ink replacement with a generic brand will not work. It will print but it won't register as full. 2018-Eight years later, it finally died. The paper pulling gears went out. I can still scan on it though but no printing.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Gaston

customer_reviews.title: This printer is great, I currently have two of them
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great, I currently have two of them. This particular printer I had to return because it was damaged upon receipt.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R. Colbert

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this printer/scanner. Calling it an all-in-one is a little bit of a stretch as it doesn't have a fax capability - but that's less and less important as time goes by. Very happy with the speed and noise levels - my biggest complaint is that it does not have a top tray for the print outs to sit on, so they literally roll out of the printer on to the floor if you have it sitting near the edge of a desk (like we do due to space constraints). Having bought many HP Deskjets in the past, I admit I assumed it would have one.
customer_reviews.author: ARLeggett

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This printer was very easy to set up, took me maybe a total of 30 min and that was taking it out of the box, going through its setup, installing the software, getting the wireless working and regestering it on the hp website. Seems to print great photos so far. It even reads my card from my camera that the photo machine at the local drug store wouldn't read. Wireless works great, and I will also be setting it up with my new laptop in a few days when I get it. I've always liked the print quality of every hp printer I've owned and I will get another one for sure.
customer_reviews.author: toms92gp

customer_reviews.title: Used.  Didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how it works when it works. Mine was used, in "good" condition by description. When started, it gave the message "at least one cartridge may have a problem", and would go no further. I installed brand new cartridges, but got the same message. Amazon took it back and refunded my money, with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth s. mcdaniel

customer_reviews.title: Move on.  You don't want this.
customer_reviews.text: Two of these pieces of crap died in a year. I took this one out back and beat it to death with a gallagher mallet. At least I got a little entertainment value out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer but with the usual HP bloatware
customer_reviews.text: This printer was fairly easy to install. I use a wireless connection to the printer rather than a USB connection. The print quality is good and it is fast. Photos print very nicely. There are a few problems though: 1) It is very difficult to insert the ink cartridges. 2) The paper has a tendency to jam. For me at least this is especially true with envelopes. 3) When you install the drivers from CD, you get the usual HP suite of bloatware that comes with it. (No I don't want to print cute greeting cards using their bloatware.)
customer_reviews.author: The Cardinal

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: Just bought the D110A two weeks ago. The installation was quick and painless. Should not present problems for any non-technical persons. Once joined to my wireless network, my Windows 7 laptop recognized it and installed the drivers automatically. All the functions work wirelessly and are easy to understand. I do like the fact it was so easy to configure wireless, as I did have some problems with other printers (Dell, Canon) when connecting them wirelessly for printing. I bought this printer because my brother has had one for six months and has not had any issues with it, so I thought it would be a good one.
customer_reviews.author: F. Mifflin

customer_reviews.title: Example of The good and the bad of HP printers
customer_reviews.text: PROS; 1. Reliable - no paper jams no problems except for pain in the neck ink level sensor. 2. Good quality scan, copy and print 3. Wireless a pleasure (I use a laptop at home) 4. Easy to use 5. Nice looking and compact Misc note: no opinion re photo-print quality (haven't printed pics)) CONS: 1. cartridges too expensive. 2. HP sensor re link level makes it awkward to use refilled (ergo cheaper) cartridges which DO work 3. NO FAX
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid Bergman

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Printer for the $$ with all the e-printing perks
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure when I ordered this because it seemed too cheap, but WOW is it great. Print quality is really good - no streaky lines or dots. The real power is in the wireless and eprinting features. Able to print wirelessly and works with Iphone AirPrint right out of the box. It also has a nice eprint feature where you can fwd yourself an email and attachments to a special private email address from anywhere and it will automatically print for you - no matter where you are. I can give the address to friends and co-workers to print things to me/for me. I love this printer!!
customer_reviews.author: Angie C

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I have had HP printers in the past and was very satisied. Then purchased a cheaper printer that had cheaper ink - WRONG!!! The printer still worked but my husband got so tired of me coplaining he told me to get a different printer. Now, I'm much happier, am able to print double sided (which was not to easy with the previous printer. Am very pleased with photo printing. Don't think I would ever buy anything but a HP printer and am always happy with my purchases from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: CAS

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer for many reasons. I don't care about printing pictures on home printers, I still rather go to Walmart or some where like that. It does print pictures pretty well though. I love the wireless feature took get rid of another wire that you don't have to have. The printer is a nice small size so it doesn't take up a lot of space but the best aspect of this printer is that the ink is pretty cheap. The black ink is like $14 and the color is about $17. I love that more than anything.
customer_reviews.author: J.Carter

customer_reviews.title: Worst HP experience ever
customer_reviews.text: This printer (and I've had at least 6 HP all-in-ones) is simply the poorest performer ever. From the start it was always coming up "unable to print or scan" requiring restarting over and over or unplugging until finally it would work. Now when I really needed to make a copy, I wasted 45 minutes and never got it to copy. Still prints, though and not bad. But if that's good enough for you, just get a printer because scanning and copying are driving me crazy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Morris

customer_reviews.title: great product for great price
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed this printer. At first I panicked because the drivers were on a CD and I don't have a CD ROM on my tiny little laptop but I was directed to the website to download the drivers from there and now it works great. I have only used it to print things and so haven't used the copier or scanner but it is nice to know I have the capability in the rare case I would need them. Also, I love the wireless feature so I can basically print from anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: RobinW

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart printer
customer_reviews.text: The printer works great. My only negative is that it only has two slots for camera cards (Duo & SD MMC.) My older version had slots for the skinny XD & the larger CF too. This mattered during the holidays when relatives relatives were over taking pictures and I wanted to download them (they did not have the cords) and I could not because I didn't have the slots for their memory cards. I actually got my old printer out hooked it up just so I could use the slots.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Dazzling photo maker
customer_reviews.text: The HP D 110 A is a remarkable printer. It works right out of the box and has some extraordinary features. A mini-screen to select the type of function you wish to use....Print...copy...scan. Simple to use and the quality of photos is remarkable. Go wireless with a few simple instructions Cost of ink is average but the ink seems to last longer than earlier HP models. Compact size lets you put it out of sight though its a very attractive package. And the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most frustrating printer I have ever dealt with in my college years. The simple task of printing out a term paper becomes the most rediculous time consuming problem this printer offers. It is the last thing you want to be dealing with after you've spent a great number of hours on your paper. The paper NEVER loads correctly. I get a paper jam 98% of the time I ever try to print. Just disappointing. Has a great user interface too, but this printer is just garbage when it actually comes to doing its actual job: printing. Find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Howie

customer_reviews.title: Really Now
customer_reviews.text: Well, you can't beat the price and free shipping. Easy to set up and use. What I didn't like: I checked my control panel to see the HP download specifics, and noticed the combined download was over 210 MB! I was able to delete around 40 MB of "Buy HP Products" stuff, which was in my opinion, unnecessary. However, I could not delete the majority of the HUGE download because it would affect the performance of my All-in-One printer. So, you're stuck with it. On the good side: A decent printer for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Cobra

customer_reviews.title: PRINTER did not work and the third party company will not take the item back
customer_reviews.text: The item does not work... TWO different IT people have NOT been able to get it to work. I want to return the product and they will not take it back... never order from a third party company called. LOS LIBROS en ESPANOL
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a little slow & buggy
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 3 years now so I guess I'm pleased with its longevity. The quality is superb and for light use of ink has stood the test of time. The wireless system I never figured out to use, was extremely difficult and I'm quite the tecchie. It's a little slow to respond but I'm pleased overall
customer_reviews.author: Ben Hanbury-Aggs

customer_reviews.title: Neat little printer.
customer_reviews.text: I am a tech guy, and this is the first printer I have ever set up without the use of a computer. It detected my wireless network and hopped right on after I entered my passkey. It checked in with the mothership and downloaded the latest firmware automatically. 5 minutes later, I was printing to it from my iPad, and 2 minutes after that I sent a file via an HP assigned email address that printed out on the printer. For a very inexpensive color printer/copier, I am thrilled by the technology built into this device.
customer_reviews.author: Austin E

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile printer!
customer_reviews.text: Great printer & copier. Versatile printing options with built in apps, WiFi, E-Print, web printing. Can print from Smartphones, iPads, Google Chrome, ... Nearly anything because it has it's own E-mail address, works with apps downloadable with Android or IOS systems, and needs no driver downloads. Print from anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Gypsee

customer_reviews.title: Very nice printer
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is a great printer. It's a good size, very fast printing, good images and easy to use. My only hiccup in the whole operation is that I tend to forget you load the paper face down. So if you have photo paper and load it face up, you with print on the back. Aside from that, loading the paper in the front of the machine is way more convenient than in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Mccleod

customer_reviews.title: Good printer.
customer_reviews.text: Like the price and quality of print. Tends to go off line if I lose power in my home and so then need to re-establish wireless connection. You should buy the available HP cartridge refills versus the cheaper, remanufactured ones since it is important to know when each cartridge runs out of ink. The cheap refills do not monitor the amount of ink left so you end up tossing both cartriges when you are not out of ink.
customer_reviews.author: R Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent home or small office printer
customer_reviews.text: This HP ink jet makes printing from an iPhone or iPad very easy and convenient. The footprint is small and it can scan, copy, and print either as a wired or wireless network printer and at the same time be used as an e-printer for your Apple devices. Printing speed and quality are good as well. Shop around for ink cartridges or use refilled ones to reduce ink costs.
customer_reviews.author: Night listener

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Does not print photos in satisfactory, professional quality color (can probably be tweaked). Otherwise excellent, reliable printer. Sets itself in standby mode, but always ready to print. In Windows 7, use the disk to install, let's you choose wireless or USB; don't use the "add printer" function. If you get this in an Amazon sale, you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: J F Arteche

customer_reviews.title: Great All In One Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many HP printers over the years and have been happy with all of them. This all in one is just wonderful! The printer does wonderful photos and it is a joy to use. I use it daily in my small business and it has been excellent as far as operating smoothly....no major problems...I would recommend this to anyone that wants a great economical printer...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: a fine printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these printers for a year, and needed to buy a printer for someone else recently, so I purchased 3 more! This is a perfectly adequate printer for most everyday uses. The scanner works well too. One of the great surprise benefits was that when I bought my new iPad2, it connects seamlessly with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: LLH

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Short and sweet: Printer is very slow Print quality is very poor, in fact this is the worst print quality of any printer I have ever owned. Setup instructions, could of been more detailed. I bought because I wanted to print from my ipad, which i can now do. Don't have many choices when it comes to printing from an ipad.
customer_reviews.author: C5

customer_reviews.title: Great with iPad 2!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer to go along with an iPad 2 so we could print documents and email from the iPad to the printer with no desktop computer or print server in between. It supports Airplay after an update to the firmware, just pop in your wireless router passcode and you are off and running! The iPad will see the printer with ease! Perfect solution for printing from all our idevices!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Snider

customer_reviews.title: Chupacabra printer
customer_reviews.text: I realize this is a common concern among printers, but really this thing sucks ink like a chupacabra draining a coyote! I spend more timed and money feeding this feral beast ink cartridges than actually printing anything. I take my print jobs to the nearest office supply and let them use their vast inventory of INK CARTRIDGES
customer_reviews.author: Phankent

customer_reviews.title: Well done, HP, well done.
customer_reviews.text: Easy unpacking, friendly front panel, easy wifi setup. Prints direct from our iPod Touch! Be sure to custom install the software and uncheck all the random HP bundled software. I kept the HP Web printing, just so my daughter doesnt waste ink printing 2 page printouts that could be one. Quality and calibration seem to be top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: I have used one like it for years and this is its replacement
customer_reviews.text: This printer works as advertised. I have used one like it for years and this is its replacement.
customer_reviews.author: acecook

customer_reviews.title: WIFI printing has worked for us like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this printer for over a year now and have had no problems at all. We connect wirelessly with all of our Apple gadgets, iPhone, iPad, laptops and desktops. I would note that you have to make sure that the wireless network that the printer is connected to is the same as the device that you are sending the print job from. I have used the scanner on occasion and it does a credible job. I have not used this to print a photograph so cannot comment on that function.
customer_reviews.author: Mark F. Sughroue

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Printer from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I have had many printers over the years. This is the best printer I ever owned. It is so awesome. It prints fast, it's wireless and it has apps. I just love it. And you can't beat the price. I only had it a few weeks and printed quite a few pages and the ink levels are still high, so it seems that it will do good on ink also. Plus the ink cartridges aren't as costly as most others. I just can't say enough about this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Deasy

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have this printer a lot because its very easy to setup. Previous wireless printers arent so easy. You plug it in, put the cartridges in, and connect to the wifi network right from the printer! Which is a huge bonus!! I would recommend this to anyone. Needed one for college, and the price is reasonable. Worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: Davidthomp

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good printer, but like with all HP printers, too much bloatware and software needed
customer_reviews.author: randumtasx

customer_reviews.title: HP Photomart D110A
customer_reviews.text: The printer works well both plugged in and wireless. The ink cartridges are reasonable Hp60, about $34 for both. The wireless feature is the reason I purchase this printer. I have an iPAD and it works great with this printer. I recommend this printer, very cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: LeoJ

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I have other HP printers but this one is the best! It was so simple to install. The ink cartridges were a little tricky to put in because they don't go in the same as my other printers but wasn't to hard to figure out. I've read other reviews about this printer being noisy but it's not bad for a "home printer". The quality of the photo prints is excellent and being able to print from a memory card it great, so easy. Don't know about the wireless feature because we don't use wireless in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: Smart Little Printer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup on the network and compatible with I-phone Air Print. Makes good, clear copies. The lack of a paper catch for completed pages is a bit frustrating, but not uncommon on these models. Not recommended for high-volume printing, this is a reliable wireless printer with a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Goodman

customer_reviews.title: It works great, although I don't use it for printing photos
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for 3 years now. It works great, although I don't use it for printing photos. My only complaint is that sometimes setting up the network can be finicky. Every now and then it needs a reset.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel S-W.

customer_reviews.title: This printer shouldn't be sold.
customer_reviews.text: This printer prints great pics. HOWEVER, I have spent over 10 hours on the phone with several different people at HP technical service trying to get the wireless working. They didn't have a clue what to do and I wanted to file a complaint. They reassured me I would be contacted within a specific timeframe. I was not. When I was finally contacted by a complaint manager, she didn't even file a complaint, she just told me it was my network and my router's company. This is very bad business..... everyone has had the same problems with this printer, not just me. So it couldn't just be my router ..
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Entering Wireless Printing
customer_reviews.text: The technology is worth the cost yet there are common printer problems to be addressed - one had a printer jam. For now, HP is still thrust worthy and printers are pure fiction in technology. One has to coupe with the grey line until everyone is under a wireless grid and digital identification. Make sure to configure your printer properties carefully. Enjoy...
customer_reviews.author: NAC

customer_reviews.title: It is the best!!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a very good quality printer, I have been using it for years and I ordered it again and the print out quality is fantastic. The seller is wonderful and a very good customer relations man. I ordered it and it was delivered same day. What more can you want in a printer? What a perfect printer from a wonderful seller
customer_reviews.author: Yomi Adebiaye

customer_reviews.title: HP D110A Printer
customer_reviews.text: I am still learning how to make full size pictures. When printing on plain paper the upper left edge comes out wrinkled. This does not seem to happen with photo paper. Prints fine with text printing. The cordless and ability to not need to wire connect to a computer is great. I bought this at Amazon and saved money.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Miller

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I have two I Pads in my house and a very,very slow lap-top. I needed a way to print from my I Pads. After going to the Apple store and getting some help and entering a e-printing app, I thought I was all set to go home and print from my home printer. Even though I had a all-in-one HP printer, it was not going to work with my I Pad. I had to bite the bullet and buy a new printer like the HP Photosmart D110A Wireless. I am 65 yrs. old and not computer savey, but with easy instructions, I got it working. I was thrilled. I believe this is a good printer for all I Pads.
customer_reviews.author: Randi

customer_reviews.title: DoA...and HP support is non-existant
customer_reviews.text: To begin, I am a computer technician and fairly competent with printer repairs as well. I just wanted a cheap printer for upstairs for my wife and her laptop. Instead I have an expensive, loud paperweight. Turn it on, and the cartridge bay just rams back and forth 2-3 times and then says cartridge error. And by rams, I mean I'm surprised it didn't break through the side. Oh, and anybody who wants to find support on HP's website I dare you to try.
customer_reviews.author: Jon I

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money!
customer_reviews.text: when the paper doesn't jam it goes offline & it's not just some photo papers that jam it is regular stock. It also does not communicate well with my HP touch screen, installs OK works twice then isn't recognized, on my HP pavilion it still prints but occasionally as it goes off line all the time... horrid waste of money for me, poor performance all around. If I did not live outside of the US and was able to return it I most certainly would!
customer_reviews.author: Carol L Rock O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: The seller was quick to resolve an ink issue
customer_reviews.text: Setting up this HP was frustrating. Took too long . I have used it alot for card projects and lije the way it handles card stock
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: HP  D110A printer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this printer. From unpacking to set up, took about 20 minutes ( I am a senior) ! I have been using it for a month or so, and no issues. Having it's own email address is really convenient for my kids to send me things without using my computers. BCL
customer_reviews.author: BCL

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart D110A Printer
customer_reviews.text: If you make greeting cards, this is the perfect printer. My cards come out looking professional and I'm very happy I purchased this. Photos also look good. When this one goes, I'm getting another HP Photosmart Printer.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Lady

customer_reviews.title: A fine little wireless machine
customer_reviews.text: I needed to add a wireless printer and this inexpensive one is great. Has both HP Eprint and AirPrint for IPad and IPhone. The copy feature also has options to make economy copies for things that do not need to be high quality. Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: CCC

customer_reviews.title: Quick delivery
customer_reviews.text: Loved this printer, so I got three of them. This one came from seller in record time, and at a great price. perfect for light work, and handy in a network.
customer_reviews.author: Batboss

customer_reviews.title: hp eprinter
customer_reviews.text: This printer is excellent for printing from any of my 4 computers including an IPAD. The setup was very easy and the apps that can be downloaded and printed are especially a nice feature. All in all I am very satified with this product.
customer_reviews.author: DonaldK

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This never worked wireless wirelesly, which is what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Garbage with eprint.  It works only 25% of the time
customer_reviews.text: This printer is the most frustrating piece of technology I own. I purchased to use with my iPad. Most of the time it doesn't work. It cancels the print jobs that I email it. I've called tech support, I've looked on the web, all to no avail. Tech support for HP is worse than Dell. The only way to get it to print most of the time is to send the attachment 3 or 4 times and it will finally print. It's is also super slow. You get what you pay for I guess and this printer was cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Horn

customer_reviews.title: Photosmart D110
customer_reviews.text: The printer is great, easy to set up, really good quality pictures. Love the wireless feature. One con is that it is extemely loud when it prints. Love the features and the eprint option. Would highly recommend this all-in-one printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mary T. Liguori

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is the best printer I have owned. The ink last for a very long time. I bought the printer last May and it is still working great. The air print works really well with my iPhone and iPad. I highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Drawde

customer_reviews.title: Great little wireless printer
customer_reviews.text: Great little printer. Takes up minimal space on the desk. Easy to set up. Easy to add more users. Works like a charm! Prints beautifully in color and black and white as well as printing my photos.
customer_reviews.author: KMMR

customer_reviews.title: Great item and it came early from the shipper!!
customer_reviews.text: I was really happy with the item that I purchased! I was not able to purchase this item in the store any longer since its an "older" model but my mother wanted wanted something simple so I got this for her. I previously had this and was happy with mine. The item was sent by Fed Ex so it was really nice that I could track the item. The item was packaged well and it arrived earlier than what was stated when I ordered the product. I would order from this shipper again!!!
customer_reviews.author: A from MN

customer_reviews.title: Amazon delivers !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have this printer in another State. I was tired of lugging it back and forth from the Chicago area to Florida for the Winter. Bought this to leave here in Florida. I do not print very much, and this suits my needs. Delivered as promised, and easy set up. I would recommend this to prospective buyers. Way to go Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Eastman

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: The price is right for a nice quality printer that has a lot of functions (color scan/copy, wifi, internet, color screen). I can print from my iPad, too! Shipped quickly, was packaged well. Easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Elsact

customer_reviews.title: Great....
customer_reviews.text: ...if you're looking for a printer that jams every single print job you use it for and poorly designed software to bring it all together. I got this for my college dorm so I was looking for the cheapest one I could find. When it works, it works fine - the wireless printing works without too much hassle (there have been a couple times I had to troubleshoot). However, if I were a prospective printer owner, I would consider paying ~ $10, $20 more for a printer that actually works every time.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I found this 2 B a great all-in-one. Set up was easy especially the wireless. The printing,scanning and coping is good. Ink is inexpensive and the best part was the price was low.
customer_reviews.author: W. Kukla

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I needed an extra printer/ scanner for E-mailing and the Photosmart D110A was just what I wanted. The set-up was easy and fast with enough options to cover my needs. I am very pleased with the scanned picture quality and love having a wireless connection. I have already recommended this printer to several people!
customer_reviews.author: LCD

customer_reviews.title: Not bad once it is set up
customer_reviews.text: This is a really neat product. I bought it so that we could print from iPads and iPhones throughout the house. I followed the instructions and got nowhere. The time it takes to setup is really long. You need a lot of patience. I actually couldn't get it to go on the first evening and it wasn't until the following day with some additional work and reading some blogs that I was able to make it work. That being said, once it is set up it seems to print pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: What a neat gizmo!,
customer_reviews.text: This HP printer is a joy! Easy to install, works great with my iPad, prints photos beautifully, and, so far, doesn't seem to guzzle the ink supply. I would highly recommend this inexpensive printer/scanner. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: C. Walters

customer_reviews.title: Good printer so far. A bit pricey.
customer_reviews.text: Good printer. Interface screen cold be better. A fast reliable printer. So far it's worth its price, which is a bit high.
customer_reviews.author: Lana Del Rey fan

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart D110A Wireless Printer
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a good printer. Haven't had any problems although we've only had it for almost 5 months. UPDATE: 2/5/13 Right after my last review in November this HP Printer started acting up, it has been nothing but problems. It only prints when it wants to! The printer says it's connected to the internet, but still doesn't print 90% of the time. I have to hard wire my laptop to the printer just so I can print. Also, it's extremely slow and noisy. I will be looking around for another printer, most likely another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: Great product, price and ink is cheap
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to set up, use, and keep maintained product. Was at a great price and makes all of the wires in our home obsolete. Replacement ink can be found on sale easily at any of the big box stores. Thanks HP
customer_reviews.author: TDKing123

customer_reviews.title: OK for Low Price
customer_reviews.text: Had a lot of intermittant network connection problems with this. The color carts cost almost as much as larger models. I replaced this with an 8600.
customer_reviews.author: nomde plume

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought the HP Photosmart D110A printer for my son who went to College this Fall. He has been unable to get the WiFi to work, nor the E-Print. I went up there in mid October and tried for three hours to get the WiFi printer and the E-Print to work, but was unable to. At this point I'm waiting until he brings it home for Thanksgiving break and attempt to call customer support to see if we can get it working.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C. Seitz

customer_reviews.title: Great Picture Printer
customer_reviews.text: I gave my husband a picture of our daughter in a decorative frame for his first father's day and the printer made the picture look very professional. I was very happy.
customer_reviews.author: TRW

customer_reviews.title: Great printer.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with my HP printer. It prints pictures really well and I'm very pleased with the scanner. I love the fact that it's wireless and the price can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer especially for the price. I love the convenient wireless feature and the email print feature. So far all the functions, copy, print, scan, have great quality.
customer_reviews.author: hasbro

customer_reviews.title: HP D110A review, recent purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased printer a little over a month ago. I needed a wireless printer for my son's laptop and my IPad. A friend (computer geek for short) of mine recommended this printer for its ease of set-up and its capabilities (especially a copier). Couldn't be more satisfied, easy to set up, prints from the peripherals with no problem, in short, so far, so good. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Takah

customer_reviews.title: This print quality is very good. If you use photo paper then the results ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for several years now. It is not used heavily but it has served well. This print quality is very good. If you use photo paper then the results are quite good. The scanner works well also. I bought it because it supported wireless printing from Apple devices. My wife can pull up a PDF file on her iPad or iPhone and print it directly to this printer. You can also print from any Mac, iMac, or windows computer. The scanner shows up immediately under Image Capture app on a Mac. Very convenient. You probably can't buy this model anymore but a successor show work as well or better.
customer_reviews.author: mrRick

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer I Bought Thus Far
customer_reviews.text: I must say this was a good buy, the photo quality is great, printing is fast, scanning, is a breeze and the ink is reasonably priced. Also haven't had any errors or problems as yet.
customer_reviews.author: nash

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. this product is lovely and is very good for use in my house and printers are excellent for all
customer_reviews.author: andamable

customer_reviews.title: Not GRADE A
customer_reviews.text: This printer arrived quickly. However the box might have been opened previously. The various items were not in a 'factory packaging' condition..and the sample photo paper was missing...It might have been targeted for sales to a foreign country as well. Grey Market? The instruction booklet had Spanish as the first set of instructions... The printer installed very easily and seems to be working fine...I would not purchase another item from this particular seller.
customer_reviews.author: Aviatrix

customer_reviews.title: Really gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. I can drag and drop photos from my computer to print from my printer. It also has it's own email address so I can print from anywhere that I can access my email. I haven't figured out how to scan from the printer to my computer yet, but that's only because I haven't taken the time to really study the instructions. Its really an awesome wireless printer.
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn M. Tate

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Its so nice to have a wireless printer. I use it with all my apple devices and print away. The setup is easy with my Macbook pro, Iphone, and iPad : )
customer_reviews.author: jcalvo04

customer_reviews.title: Airprint Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad printer for the price. Seems to work fine with Eprint and WiFi. Does not work at all with AirPrint from an IPAD. Many people have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Hank K

customer_reviews.title: Great Network Printer
customer_reviews.text: This Printer is a great inexpensive network printer, with good quality. It is very easy to set up. The best thing about this printer is the e-print options. I have an IPhone with iOS4.2. I can now view any document or email or web page on my phone and send a print job directly to this printer across the wireless network. It is great, I will look up coupons on the internet from my phone and print them out. No need to turn on the laptop to print anymore.
customer_reviews.author: RonMCSE

customer_reviews.title: HP D110A from amazon
customer_reviews.text: I just recevied this printer and the first thing I noticed was all the printing on the package was in Spanish with the comment this unit to be sold in Latin America only. I would think that if this is for sale outside of the U.S. it would say so in the advertising. I order a lot of items from Amazon and this is the first time I received something like this. This is pretty sad when you order something in the U.S. and you don't get an English version.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: AirPrint was my main reason to buy this, unfortunately, it wasn't very good.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great product and does exactly what a printer should, however, the only con was its connectivity with my iOS and OS X devices to AirPrint even though it clearly says it's compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Dario Sepulveda

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer....can print wirelessly from my Galaxy S phone and laptop....would recommend to anyone who is looking for a wireless option.
customer_reviews.author: ATown

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE IN A PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: I HAD ONE OF THESE ALREADY AND I LOVE IT SO MUCH , I PURCHASED ANOTHER. TOO MANY FEATURES TO LIST BUT WHAT I DO LOVE ABOUT IT IS THE WIRELESS PRINTING ( NO CORDS ) BUT THE GREATEST THING OF THEM ALL IS THE ABILITY TO PRINT ANYTHING FROM ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD AT ANY TIME AND IT WILL PRINT ON YOUR PRINTER BY SENDING IT TO A SPECIFIC EMAIL PROGRAMMED INTO THE PRINTER. ITS WONDERFUL
customer_reviews.author: JESUS FERNANDEZ

customer_reviews.title: It is supposed to be a photsmart but isn't.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this thinking it would be better than the Lexmark 4-1 but I can't get the 4x6 paper to even load. I take a lot of photos so I'm really disappointed about that. The only reason I haven't sent it back is that the scanner works. The scanner on the Lexmark didn't. Also, the size of it is better than the Lexmark.
customer_reviews.author: CannonNICENEASY

customer_reviews.title: HP PRINTER PHOTOSMART D110A
customer_reviews.text: Hi, thanks for the prodducto is of very good quality, contains all the features, tools, technical support and assistance for both its operation and to solve their details when they arise, which must contain a printer. Thank you very much for its quality of service, continue to work with great responsibility. Recommend products and services of the seller, are responsible, friendly, easily accessible communication, 100% efeciente. thanks
customer_reviews.author: Rosmel

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to use with my Iphone. It works great and uses not a lot of ink. Pictures are very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn R

customer_reviews.title: wireless printer
customer_reviews.text: It is working great with my Vista laptop, but lost a star since I can't seem to get it to work wirelessly with my new windows 7 system computer.
customer_reviews.author: Kalf

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for 70 bucks
customer_reviews.text: Nice job HP - easy to setup and works as advertised! The iPhone/iPad printing works great and the ePrint is pretty cool too. Don't think twice about buying this little printer.
customer_reviews.author: Toeknife

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected, and the seller transaction was smooth!
customer_reviews.author: Ken H

customer_reviews.title: Printer Review
customer_reviews.text: The printer is easy to hook up and easy to use. I was surprised at how easily it was to install and use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleased Customer
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with my purchase. I was looking for a printer that I could use with my iPad2 and it worked very well. The color is good. It prints my photos as well as copy with high quality. The cost was was very inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Riek

product_meta.title: HP Photosmart D110A Wireless Printer (CN731A#B1H)
product_meta.description:
Count on the HP Photosmart e-All-in-one for everything you print, including photos, documents and Web content. Make your own photo books, calendars, collages and greeting cards using HP Photo Creations software. Use the HP TouchSmart Frame to print Web content like coupons, recipes and more without using a PC. Plus, print wirelessly from any room in your home and share your photo printer with multiple people. Simply touch one button for easy wireless setup. Print from anywhere, anytime to the HP Photosmart e-All-in-One. Send emails, photos and everyday documents from a smartphone, notebook PC or other mobile device directly to your photo printer. Save power with this ENERGY STAR qualified product, plus save paper by printing multiple pages on a single sheet. Edit and print lab-quality photos without a PC using the memory card slots and 2.36-Inch LCD with TouchSmart Frame. With this HP photo printer, original HP inks and HP Advanced Photo Paper, your prints will last for generations.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Count on the HP Photosmart e-All-in-one for everything you print, including photos, documents and Web content. Make your own photo books, calendars, collages and greeting cards using HP Photo Creations software. Use the HP TouchSmart Frame to print Web content like coupons, recipes and more without using a PC. Plus, print wirelessly from any room in your home and share your photo printer with multiple people. Simply touch one button for easy wireless setup. Print from anywhere, anytime to the HP Photosmart e-All-in-One. Send emails, photos and everyday documents from a smartphone, notebook PC or other mobile device directly to your photo printer. Save power with this ENERGY STAR qualified product, plus save paper by printing multiple pages on a single sheet. Edit and print lab-quality photos without a PC using the memory card slots and 2.36-Inch LCD with TouchSmart Frame. With this HP photo printer, original HP inks and HP Advanced Photo Paper, your prints will last for generations.


WHY BUY?




SPECIAL OFFER



FUNCTIONS




FEATURES






SPECIFICATIONS





REMEMBER ORIGINAL HP INK AND PAPER



SAVE MONEY when you choose high-capacity cartridges over standard ones







MORE INFORMATION



WHICH HP PRINTER IS RIGHT FOR YOU? 




Compare the good, better and best side-by-side







 1. Requires a wireless access point and an Internet connection to the printer. Services may require registration. Apps availability varies by country and language. For details, http://www.hp.com/go/ePrinterCenter.
 2. Requires an internet connection to the printer. Feature works with any internet- and email-capable device. Print times may vary. For a list of supported documents and image types, see www.hp.com/go/ePrintCenter.
 3. Supports iOS 4.2 devices (iPad, iPhone 4, iPhone 3GS, and 3rd and 4th generation iPod touch) that support multitasking. Works with HP ePrint-enabled printers and All-in-Ones. AirPrint and iOS 4.2 devices require an 802.11 wireless network connection to the printer. Wireless performance is dependent upon physical environment and distance from the access point. AirPrint and the AirPrint logo are trademarks of Apple Inc. iPad, iPhone and iPod touch are trademarks of Apple Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries.
 4. After first page; see www.hp.com/go/inkjetprinter for details.
 5. Average based on ISO/IEC 24711 or HP testing methodology and continuous printing. Actual yield varies considerably based on content of printed pages and other factors. Some ink from included cartridge is used to start up the printer. For details see www.hp.com/go/learnaboutsupplies.
feature_bullets: Now AirPrint compatible. Simply print from iPhone, iPad, and iPod Touch.
Print, copy, scan with a 2.36-Inch LCD (with TouchSmart frame)
Quickly print from the Web without using a PC
Print anywhere, anytime, with any device
Save energy and conserve resources (Energy Star qualified)
